intro: Desplatsia dewevrei, commonly known as the Dewevre's spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
